subject: Re: Editing EVP
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Margaret, I do agree with that whole-heartedly.  I found myself 
almost changing the word skeptic to cynic in my former post. ;)

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi LC and Stefan.  I think the term skeptic is often misapplied to 
those who are cynics.  
> Skepticism is healthy and usually these people are somewhat open-
minded given enough 
> persuasive evidence, whereas someone who is cynical is not open to 
changing their view 
> no matter how much evidence is presented them.  
> 
> Just a thought that semantics might be getting in the way here, 
with some people using 
> the word skeptic in it traditional/literal sense of the word, and 
other are actually meaning 
> "cynic" but using the term skeptic.
> 
> Margaret
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> >
> > Stefan, yes, I agree.  
> > 
> > I should clarify.  Some skeptics/critics never intend to 
> > believe...their mind is made up.  That's who I avoid.  Now a 
skeptic or 
> > critic who is at least open to the possibility of communication 
from 
> > the other side, I will point them in a direction to seek answers 
within 
> > for themselves.  :)
> > 
> > LC
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Hi LC,
> > > 
> > > > There will always be skeptics and critics, but one thing seems
> > > > certain: everyone has their own time when they become open to 
the 
> > > > possibility of the paranormal/spiritual existing.  I just 
choose to 
> > > > share with those whose time has come.  :)
> > > 
> > > I wouldn't see an skeptical/critical attitude as something 
negative.
> > > Some people just aren't "believers", their intellect wants to be
> > > satisfied, too. :)
> > > 
> > > So being skeptical/critical doesn't necessarily mean not being a
> > > "seeker".
> > > 
> > > Stefan
> > >
> >
>
